API Lifecycle

Blueprints

Providing a framework to define the API lifecycle in a modular and flexible enough way that anyone can use to define their own version of the API lifecycle using a common set of elements and actions being applied across operations.

Choose Your Entrance into the API Lifecycle

Base

These are the base blueprints we use to define the API lifecycle, laying a base that anyone can work from to define their own.

  • →The Base of the API Lifecycle - This represents the base of the API lifecycle that anyone should be thinking about.
  • →Everything but the Kitchen Sink - Contains all of the elements grouped by some of the common areas of the API lifecycle.

New

If you are creating a new API, these are the blueprints we recommend as your entrance to the API lifecycle for your organization.

  • →New API Using the OpenAPI Specification - A blueprint for beginning the API lifecycle by designing a new API using an OpenAPI.
  • →New API Using the AsyncAPI Specification - A blueprint for beginning an event-driven API lifecycle by designing a new API using an AsyncAPI.
  • →Prototype an New API Using a Postman Collection - A blueprint for beginning the API lifecycle by prototyping an API using a Postman collection.

Existing

If you are working with an existing API, these are the blueprints we recommend as your entrance to the API lifecycle.

  • →Manually Define Collection for Existing API - A blueprint for beginning the API lifecycle by manually defining a collection.
  • →Generate OpenAPI a New API Using Code Annotations - A blueprint for beginning the API lifecycle by automatically generating an OpenAPI.
  • →Import WSDL for an Existing SOAP Web Service - A blueprint for beginning the API lifecycle by importing a WSDL for an existing SOAP web service.

Automation

If you are working with an existing API, these are the blueprints we recommend as your entrance to the API lifecycle.

  • →Build a Business Workflow - A blueprint for beginning the API lifecycle by designing a new API using an OpenAPI.
  • →Test Automation - A blueprint for understanding the different aspects of API test automation.

About this API Lifecycle Project

This project runs on Github, and the lifecycle blueprints, elements, and actions are defined as YAML, and the website is powered using Jekyll, allowing everything to be updated in a collaborative way using Git.
